column2: Description
The year used by the manufacturer to designate a model of vehicle
column3: To help you compare vehicles from different model years, fuel consumption ratings for 1995 to 2014 vehicles have been adjusted to reflect the 5-cycle testing procedure. Note that these are approximate values that were generated from the original ratings, not from vehicle testing.

column2: The manufacturer of the vehicle
The model name of the vehicle
column3:
AWD = All-wheel drive – vehicle designed to operate with all wheels powered
4WD/4X4 = Four-wheel drive – vehicle designed to operate with either two wheels or four wheels powered
FFV = Flexible-fuel vehicle – vehicle designed to operate on gasoline and ethanol blends of up to 85% ethanol (E85)
CNG = Compressed natural gas; NGV = Natural gas vehicle
SWB = Short wheelbase; LWB = Long wheelbase; EWB = Extended wheelbase
# = High output engine

column2: Classification of the vehicle based on interior volume for cars and gross vehicle weight rating for light trucks
Total displacement of all cylinders (in litres)
Number of engine cylinders
The type of transmission and number of gears/speeds
column3: A = Automatic; AM = Automated manual; AS = Automatic with select shift; AV = Continuously variable; M = Manual

column2: The type of fuel used to power the vehicle
column3:
X = Regular gasoline; Z = Premium gasoline; D = Diesel; E = E85; N = Natural Gas
For FFVs, consumption values are provided for both gasoline and E85.

column2: City fuel consumption rating shown in litres per 100 kilometres
column3: The city rating represents urban driving in stop-and-go traffic.

column2: Highway fuel consumption rating shown in litres per 100 kilometres
column3: The highway rating represents a mix of open highway and rural road driving, typical of longer trips.

column2: Combined fuel consumption rating shown in litres per 100 kilometres
column3: The combined rating reflects 55% city driving and 45% highway driving.

column2: The combined rating expressed in miles per imperial gallon
The vehicle's tailpipe emissions of carbon dioxide shown in grams per kilometre for combined city and highway driving
The vehicle's tailpipe emissions of carbon dioxide rated on a scale from 1 (worst) to 10 (best)
The vehicle's tailpipe emissions of smog-forming pollutants rated on a scale from 1 (worst) to 10 (best)

column3: AWD = All-wheel drive – vehicle designed to operate with all wheels powered

column2: Classification of the vehicle based on interior volume for cars and gross vehicle weight rating for light trucks
Electric motor peak power output (in kilowatts)
Total displacement of all cylinders (in litres)
Number of engine cylinders
The type of transmission and number of gears/speeds
column3: A = Automatic; AM = Automated manual; AS = Automatic with select shift; AV = Continuously variable

column2: The type of fuel used to power the vehicle in electric mode
column3:
B = Electricity; X = Regular gasoline; Z = Premium gasoline
In electric mode, a series plug-in hybrid electric vehicle uses electricity only. A blended plug-in hybrid electric vehicle may operate using electricity only or both electricity and gasoline.
An asterisk (*) indicates that in testing, this vehicle did not use any gasoline during electric mode operation. However, depending on how you drive the vehicle, you may use gasoline during electric mode operation following a full charge.

column2: Combined fuel consumption rating for electric mode operation expressed in gasoline litres equivalent per 100 kilometres. Electricity consumption in kilowatt hours per 100 kilometres and gasoline consumption (where applicable) in litres per 100 kilometres are shown in parentheses.
column3: The combined rating reflects 55% city driving and 45% highway driving. One litre of gasoline contains the energy equivalent to 8.9 kWh of electricity.

column2: Estimated driving distance (in kilometres) on a fully charged battery
Estimated time (in hours) to fully recharge the battery at 240 volts
The type of fuel used to power the vehicle in gasoline-only mode
column3: X = Regular gasoline; Z = Premium gasoline

column2: City fuel consumption rating for gasoline-only mode shown in litres per 100 kilometres
column3: The city rating represents urban driving in stop-and-go traffic.

column2: Highway fuel consumption rating for gasoline-only mode shown in litres per 100 kilometres
column3: The highway rating represents a mix of open highway and rural road driving, typical of longer trips.

column2: Combined fuel consumption rating for gasoline-only mode shown in litres per 100 kilometres
column3: The combined rating reflects 55% city driving and 45% highway driving.

column2: Estimated driving distance (in kilometres) on a full tank of fuel
The vehicle's tailpipe emissions of carbon dioxide shown in grams per kilometre for combined city and highway driving
column3: For plug-in hybrid electric vehicles, CO2 emissions values reflect a mix of electric mode and gasoline-only operation.
